finalProject

Class Forward

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalProject.Forward

  • public class Forward
extends java.lang.Object
    The Forward class is the controlling class which will be called after the initial localization process of the robot has been completed. The robot will be told where the ball dispenser is and told to go to that position and move to an orientation and position from which it can receive a ball. The robot will then lower its arm and receive the ball before traveling to the edge of the forward line and shooting the ball at the target. Once this has been completed, the robot should repeat the process for the duration of the round. During all movements, the correction and obstacle avoidance algorithms should be called continuously to ensure the robot moves to exactly the right position without hitting any obstacles.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ilana Haddad

      • Forward

        public Forward(Navigation navigation,

       int corner,
       int d1,
       int w1,
       int w2,
       int bx,
       int by,
       java.lang.String omega)
        The Forward constructor
        Parameters:
        corner - the corner which the robot starts in
        d1 - the position of the line separating the forward and defensive zones
        w1 - one of the two coordinates of the bounce zone
        w2 - one of the two coordinates of the bounce zone
        bx - the x coordinate of the ball dispenser
        by - the y coordinate of the ball dispenser
        omega - the orientation of the robot
        navigation - the navigation system of the robot
        odometer - the odometer of the robot

    • Method Detail

      • startFWD

        public void startFWD()
        The start Forward method should begin directly after localization and call navigation to move the ball to the dispenser. At this point, the class should turn the robot to a heading from which it can receive a ball and lower the arm. Then, when the ball has been received, the method should call the launcher class to float the launcher arm using the holding bar to keep it in place. Then, the method should navigate the robot to the edge of the forward line and call for the ball to be shot toward the goal before repeating the process for the remainder of the round.

      • motorstop

        public void motorstop()
        This method is used to very quickly stop the robot from moving in whatever direction it is moving in before setting it's speed to be 150 degrees/second shortly afterward.
